result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew C Mundt

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew C Mundt in court.  Attorney Danuta Kurczewski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alex Gelhar in court for Andrew C Mundt.
PLQ filed with the Court.
Def. Plea to Ct. 1 in 21CF372 - Guilty
Court quest. defendant & advised of rights
Court finds the defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 21CF372
Ct. 2 in 21CF372 Dismissed and read in
Ct. 3 in 21CF372 Dismissed
21TR3001, 21TR3002, 22CF128 & 22CF201 - Dismissed and read in
Stmt. ADA and Atty. Gelhar sentencing
Court sentences the Def. to 6 years in Prison with 2 years initial confinement and 4 years of Ext. supervision; fine of $2,200 plus costs 
for a total of $3,894.60 (Blood test fee); revocation DL 3 yrs.; IID 3 yrs; AODA & DS Plan; 6 points.
Def. eligible for substance abuse program. 
2 days Credit
Conditions of Ext. Supv. - Pay costs of the action; Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV. Shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system.  Shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.  Not operate a motor vehicle without Ignition Interlock Device.
Advised of appeal rights; firearm and voting.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Stipulation and Order to Amend Bond
Stipulation and Order to Amend Bond
Status conference on July 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:30 pm
ADA Kurczewski present in court.
Def. present in court.
Atty. Alex Gelhar present in court.
Statements by the Court.
Statements by Atty. Gelhar.
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights to a PRELIM hearing, finds probable cause exists and binds matter over for ARGN to Branch III.
Information to be filed w/court.
Waive reading & receipt of information.
Def. stands mute on entry of plea - court enters NG plea on behalf of def.
Statements by counsel re:  bond condition (alcohol monitoring program condition) when def. works for the farmer, Dennis Roe - counsel reached a stipulation as to the details.
STC:  7-19-2022 at 10:00 am 1970
Bond continued.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew C Mundt
Current: N11638 Town Hall Road, Marion, WI 54950 United States  (Effective: 06-01-2022)
Prior: 709 E Alfred St, Weyauwega, WI 54983

Clerked by R.L.H.
1:19pm
ADA Kurczewski - present.
Atty. Drury - present via Zoom.
Defendant - present via Zoom (in custody).
Stmnts by Atty. Drury.
Stmnts by ADA Kurczewski.
Further stmnts by Atty. Drury.
Waive time limits for PH.
Court orders bond be amended - $500.00 cash bond with the following conditions:
-Report within 21 days to the Waupaca County Sheriff's Department to submit to the booking process.  You are required to make an appointment by calling (715) 942-1887. 
-Defendant must reside at Dennis Roe's residence through 6/15 - effective 6/16, def. will need to be in compliance with the Waupaca County alcohol monitoring program.
-Not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
PH:6/16/22 at 2:30pm with 1970
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Clerked by R.L.H.
2:15pm
ADA Kurczewski - present.
Atty Gelhar - present.
Defendant - present.
Def. is SPD eligible. 
Def. feeling ill and not in courtroom.
Complaint received, reading waived.
Def. now present in jury box.
PH is requested.
ADA Kurczewski requests a cash bond.
Stmnts by Atty. Gelhar - requests a signature bond.
Court orders $500.00 cash bond (see bond for conditions)
PH: 6/9/22 at 9:30am with 1970
